definition: prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: A case against Google could update antitrust law for the Internet age.
sentences.chinese: 指控谷歌可能爲互聯網時代修訂反托拉斯法。

sentences.english: They set up a family trust for their grandchildren.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲其孫子孫女成立了家庭托拉斯。

sentences.english: Will the computer industry ever escape its antitrust problems?
sentences.chinese: 計算機產業能克服其自身的反托拉斯問題嗎？

sentences.english: In terms of antitrust, Oracle also seems safe.
sentences.chinese: 在反托拉斯方面甲骨文似乎也是安全的。

sentences.english: Justice officials are investigating whether the merger violates anti-trust laws.
sentences.chinese: 法務部官員正在調查該合併案是否違反反托拉斯法。

sentences.english: The paper concludes that the Anti - trust law and the patent policy facilitate the rise of US Industrial research.
sentences.chinese: 反托拉斯法和專利政策促進了美國工業研究的興起。

sentences.english: With this judgment Europe and America have clearly moved further apart in antitrust matters.
sentences.chinese: 這一判決表明歐美在反托拉斯問題上的立場漸行漸遠。

sentences.english: Trustbusters need to be wary of such claims.
sentences.chinese: 但托拉斯破壞者要慎用這種指控。

sentences.english: The federal government brought suit to dissolve the trust.
sentences.chinese: 聯邦政府爲了解散這個托拉斯而提出起訴。

sentences.english: The Anti-Trust Act was a resounding success, or so it seemed.
sentences.chinese: 《反托拉斯法》獲得巨大成功，至少看似如此。

sentences.english: SHEP O'NEAL: President Roosevelt believed the company violated the Sherman Anti-Trust Law.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯福總統認爲這個公司違反了謝爾曼的反托拉斯法。

sentences.english: A fundamental tension exists between intellectual property and antitrust law.
sentences.chinese: 智慧財產及反托拉斯法之間，先天就有所衝突。
